column2: Return to Dumnonia

Your father, the great Uther Pendragon, King of Dumnonia, has died, leaving your clubfooted infant nephew Mordred as King of Dumnonia. Following on the oaths made in your name, you have returned to Dumnonia to protect the kingdom and your nephew's inheritance from those who would sunder the realm apart. Eagerly received by those who see you as their saviour in this time of strife and uncertainty, you have been appointed Lord of Durnac by the current regent.
Dumnonia shall not fall!
Death of King Uther Pendragon

Uther Pendragon, King of Dumnonia, is dead. The only legitimate heir to the throne, Mordred, is a clubfooted child. Upon receiving news of his father's death, Uther's bastard son, Arthur, has returned from the kingdom of Benoic and has been appointed Lord of Durnac by the current regent.
Hail to King Mordred and Lord Arthur!
Let us hope Arthur will drive the Saxons back to the sea!
We will conquer their lands, no matter who is leading them...
This is interesting news...
Arthur Returns to Dumnonia

Upon receiving news of his father's death, King Uther's bastard son, Arthur, has returned to Dumnonia from the kingdom of Benoic, where he was sent by Uther to assist King Ban in his wars against the Franks. Upon arrival, Arthur has been appointed Lord of Durnac by your current regent.
A loyal vassal... or is he plotting for my throne?

With a child on the throne and enemies surrounding it on all sides, Dumnonia has never been in a greater need of a strong ruler. While most people have faith in your ability to administer the kingdom in Mordred's place, many are looking at Arthur, Uther's bastard son, as Dumnonia's only hope in these troubled times. Perhaps it would be better to leave the regency to him?

With a child on the throne and enemies surrounding it on all sides, Dumnonia has never been in a greater need of a strong ruler. While most people have faith in your ability to administer the kingdom in Mordred's place, many felt that Arthur was a great leader and that he should continue to hold power in the realm. Perhaps it would be better to leave the regency to him?
Arthur would be a much better ruler than I ever could.
We have no need for Arthur. I will stave off the Saxons myself!

Recognizing your military prowess and ability to unite the kingdom against the Saxons, [From.GetTitledName] has offered to make you regent of Dumnonia. While Mordred is still technically the king, many hope that you will be able to lead the kingdom against its many enemies and restore its strength and prosperity.

Recognizing your military prowess and ability to unite the kingdom against the Saxons, [From.GetTitledName] has offered to make you regent of Dumnonia once more. While Mordred is still technically the king, many hope that you will be able once again to lead the kingdom against its many enemies and restore its strength and prosperity.
It is for the good of the kingdom.

Your current regent has stepped aside to allow Arthur to become regent of Dumnonia. Known as a great warrior from his campaigns against the Franks and Saxons, Arthur could be key to holding off the Saxons to the east, yet as the son of Uther he has a claim to the throne, and many think that Arthur, not you, should be the king...

Your current regent has stepped aside to allow Arthur to become regent of Dumnonia once more. Many see him as the realm's saviour and Arthur could indeed be key to holding off the Saxons to the east, yet his claim to the throne could still be problematic...
A great warrior, perhaps, but is he plotting for my throne?

The current regent of Dumnonia has stepped aside to allow Arthur to gain control of Dumnonia. Known as a great warrior from his campaigns against the Franks and Saxons, Arthur could be key to holding off the Saxons to the east that seek to conquer our lands. As the son of Uther, he has a claim to the throne, yet he seems to show no ambition to take it from Mordred...

The current regent of Dumnonia has stepped aside to allow Arthur to retake control of Dumnonia. Many see him as the realm's saviour and Arthur could indeed be key to holding off the Saxons to the east that seek to conquer our lands. As the son of Uther, he has a claim to the throne, yet he seems to continue to show no ambition to take it from Mordred...
Arthur will save us from the Saxons!
The Wolftails

Under the guidance of Merlin and the training of Hywel, Derfel Cadarn has grown to be quite a capable warrior. Honest and loyal, he is devoted to your cause and would make a great general in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies. If we make him a lord of his own band of warriors he could be a useful vassal and ally against the Saxons.
I will grant him a band of warriors as his own.
He does not deserve such an honour yet.
The Wolftails

Impressed by your skills as a warrior, [From.GetTitledName] has decided to grant you a band of warriors to call your own. Using the tails of wolves attached to your helmets as an emblem, you have decided to name your new band "The Wolftails", one that will in time surely strike fear into the hearts of Anglo-Saxons everywhere.
I will serve Arthur loyally and well!
The Wolftails

Your uncle and regent, [From.GetTitledName], has decided to grant the young but skilled Derfel Cadarn his own band of warriors and make him a lord. This new band, which calls itself "The Wolftails", has sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Derfel's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur.

Your regent, [From.GetTitledName] has decided to grant young but skilled Derfel Cadarn his own band of warriors and make him a lord. This new band, which calls itself "The Wolftails", has sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Derfel's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur...
A band of noble warriors... or a tool for Arthur to gain my throne?
The Rise of Arthur

After the death of his father Uther, your friend and patron Arthur returned to Dumnonia to become regent for his young nephew Mordred. In need of experienced warriors to defend the realm against his many enemies, he has invited you and your band of horsemen to join him in Dumnonia to help him fulfill his oath to protect the kingdom.

After the death of his father Uther, your friend and patron Arthur returned to Dumnonia to become its new king. In need of experienced warriors to defend the realm against his many enemies, he has invited you and your band of horsemen to join him in Dumnonia to help him fulfill his oath to protect the kingdom.
I will join my friend and help him however I can!
I will pursue my own destiny away from Dumnonia.
The Brotherhood Horsemen

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your close friend during your campaigns in Armorica, has come to [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to [Root.Liege.GetTitledName] and are promising to help you in whatever way they can in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies.

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your close friend during your campaigns in Armorica, has come to [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to you and are promising to help you in whatever way they can in the fight against [Root.TopLiege.PrimaryTitle.GetName]'s enemies.
Excellent! Together we will drive the Saxons out of Britannia!
The Brotherhood Horsemen

Sagramor, the famed Numidian warrior and your Arthur's close friend , has come to [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetName] with his powerful band of horsemen. The Brotherhood Horsemen have sworn fealty to you and will fight for you in your wars, but Sagramor's true loyalties have always lied with Arthur...
A band of noble warriors... or a plot of Arthur to gain my throne?
Arthur, the Imperator

A wave of cheers and shouts ring through the crowds of [Root.Location.GetName] as your vassals acclaim you as the true ruler of Dumnonia. Though you shun the title of King that your father and nephew once held, your vassals still quietly call you one, and your closest entourage see fit to view you as Imperator of southern Britain, a worthy successor to the glory of Romans before you.
There are some who still view Mordred as King, though.
The Decline of Dumnonia

King Uther of Dumnonia has died, bringing his long and prosperous reign to a close. The former High King led the Britons against the advance of the Anglo-Saxons and greatly expanded his kingdom to the east, subjugating the heirs of the Atrebates, Belgae, and Dobunni, and bringing hope to the beleagured land once more.\n\nHis death without an heir, however, has left the kingdom divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, claiming that their oaths of fealty were to Uther and Uther only. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

Arthur Pendragon, King of Dumnonia and the hero of the Britons, is dead. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build.\n\nWith the great king's final breath, however, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

Mordred, King of Dumnonia, is dead. Ascending the throne from a young age after the untimely demise of his father, his early reign was marked by infighting between those who supported and resented Arthur's influence over the regency and the constant invasions of the Saxons.\n\nStill, many respected Mordred's position as Uther's only legitimate heir, and the kingdom managed to hold itself together throughout his reign. Now, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

[Root.GetFirstName], King of Dumnonia, has died. As the [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the great king Uther, [Root.GetSheHe] fought hard against internal divisions and the invasions of the Saxons to preserve [Root.GetHerHis] father's kingdom. \n\nWith [Root.GetFirstName]'s demise and the fading of Uther's legacy, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

King Uther of Dumnonia has been cast from his throne, bringing his long and prosperous reign to a close. The former High King led the Britons against the advance of the Anglo-Saxons and greatly expanded his kingdom to the east, subjugating the heirs of the Atrebates, Belgae, and Dobunni, and bringing hope to the beleagured land once more.\n\nUther's deposition, however, has left the kingdom in chaos. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, claiming that their oaths of fealty were to Uther and Uther only. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

The great hero of the Britons, Arthur Pendragon, has been deposed from his throne. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build.\n\nThe downfall of Arthur, however, has left the kingdom in chaos. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

His hold on power never fully certain, King Mordred of Dumnonia has been deposed. Ascending the throne from a young age after the untimely demise of his father, his early reign was marked by infighting between those who supported and resented Arthur's influence over the regency and the constant invasions of hte Saxons.\n\nStill, many respected Mordred's position as Uther's only legitimate heir. Now, the kingdom has been left in chaos, with its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?

[Root.GetFirstName], King of Dumnonia, has been unseated from his throne. As the [Root.GetSonDaughter] of the great king Uther, [Root.GetSheHe] fought hard against internal divisions and the invasions of the Saxons to preserve [Root.GetHerHis] father's kingdom. \n\nWith [Root.GetFirstName]'s demise and the fading of Uther's legacy, the kingdom has been left divided, and its future uncertain. Already the lords of the east have begun to reassert their sovereignty, asserting that their oaths of fealty were only to Uther and his immediate heirs. Will the new untested king be able to hold the kingdom together, or will the south of Britannia fragment once more?
Dumnonia must prevail!
Will we have our freedom again?
Who will hold back the barbarians now?
Nobody can stop us now!
This is interesting news...
Death of Arthur

Arthur Pendragon, King of Dumnonia and the High King of the Britons, is dead. Seen by many as Britannia's best hope against the Saxons, the bastard son of Uther struggled against a myriad of external enemies and his own personal troubles to preserve the realm his father had fought hard to build, finally managing to unite the Britons under his banner to present a unified resistance against hte Germanic invaders.\n\nArthur's death spells the end of an era for the Britons. Will anybody be able to live up to the great King's legacy? Or will the Britons be doomed to a future of infighting, defeat, and subjugation, as the Anglo-Saxons seek to expand their realms once more?
I will make Arthur proud!
A great man and hero is dead.
The age of the Britons is over!
This is interesting news...

As regent, most of Dumnonia supports you, but not all. The right marriage will shore up your position at court, and especially among the other kings who still eye Dumnonia for themselves. Princess Ceinwyn, the Star of Powys, is the logical choice, cementing an alliance with Gorfyddyd, the powerful King of Powys. But Princess Guinevere of the lost kingdom, Henis Wyren, radiates an aura of destiny. She will marry a great man, and thinks you are one, despite your bastardry. Will you put the interests of Dumnonia aside, for a woman who sets your heart aflame?
I love the brilliant, bewitching Guinevere. She must be my bride.
I can suffer the beautiful and kind Ceinwyn, for Britannia.
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.Liege.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.

In a surprising move, the famed warrior Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle], has announced his marriage to your courtier Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. Apparently, he spurned many other more wealthy and connected princesses for this choice, so great was his his love and yearning for Guinevere.

The great Arthur might be unparalleled among men, but he has never faced a woman like yourself versed in the ways of romance and seduction. Indeed, a smile here, a wink there, and now Arthur is practically begging you to marry him.
My blessings to the newlyweds, I suppose.
I see greatness in Arthur. We will share it together.
He lacks in ambition. I can do better.

You have tried everything you can think of, made every tearful plea your mouth will produce, but still the beautiful Guinevere resolutely refuses to take your hand in marriage. It seems that despite all she has done to attract your attention and pull at your heart, she has simply lost interest in you.
But... but why?

You were shocked when Ceinwyn ran off and disappeared at her wedding - you had always known that she was stubborn, but not that she was capable of something like this! Now, you have heard that she has eloped with Derfel Cadarn, one of Arthur's soldiers in Dumnonia, pledging to never formally marry but to live with him as husband and wife.

From the moment you first saw Derfel Cadarn you knew you two were meant to be together. Your father may have had other plans for you, but no matter - all it took was a bit of running off to elope with your love. A princess can't exactly marry a lowly soldier, but that doesn't mean you can't still spend the rest of your life with him...
Well, that was a surprise.
We will be together for all time.
She did what?!? How could my Ceinwyn do this?!?

You always did know that your courtier Derfel was in love with Ceinwyn, the Princess of Powys, but never did you think anything would come of it. So you were very surprised when she suddenly appeared in your court without warning with Derfel, and even more so when word got to you they had apparently pledged to spend the rest of their lives together.

You were in love the moment you laid your eyes on her, but you knew that a lowly soldier like you never had a chance with the brilliant Ceinwyn, the Star of Powys. Yet you never gave up hope, and apparently Ceinwyn thought the same... and now she has run off to elope with you, pledging to be at your side forever.
A fine catch, Derfel. I am impressed.
You... you really did it!

A diplomat from Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle] and hero of the Britons, has arrived in your court asking for the hand in marriage of your [GetFromRelation] Ceinwyn, Princess of Powys. He offers an alliance between the two leading kingdoms of Britannia to fight against the Saxons together, and promises to treat her with the utmost love and respect deserving of a princess.

A diplomat from Arthur, [Root.GetArthurTitle] and hero of the Britons, has arrived in your court asking for your hand in marriage, wishing to cement an alliance between Powys and Dumnonia against the Saxons. While he isn't quite the man that you truly love in your heart, his honour and integrity is second to none and you know that he can truly be trusted.
A worthy husband for my Star.
§Y[This.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.
I suppose I could do much worse than Arthur.
No. He's just not the right man.

Your regent, Arthur, has announced his marriage to Ceinwyn, the Princess of Powys, sealing an alliance between Dumnonia and [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName]. Arthur and [From.GetTitledFirstName] have expressed their hope that this new alliance between the two former rivals will enable the Britons to form a united front against the Saxons.
But is the alliance with me, or with Arthur?
§Y[From.GetTitledName]§! and §Y[Root.GetTitledName]§! sign a non-aggression pact.
You were somewhat surprised to receive a polite, but firm, statement from [From.GetBestName] refusing your offer of a marriage alliance. Apparently, [From.GetSheHe] has 'other plans'.
A pity. It would have brought peace to Britannia.

During a visit to your court, Lancelot, [Root.GetLancelotStatus], seems to have been quickly enamoured with your courtier Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. Somewhat to your surprise, the proud and haughty princess seems to have been quite receptive, and after spending a number of days courting each other the two have announced their marriage.

You were somewhat disappointed when Arthur married Ceinwyn - despite clearly having shown interest in you - but that all disappeared when you met Lancelot, [Root.GetLancelotStatus]. He may not quite be Arthur's equal and his claims of greateness are slightly suspect, but his ambition and haughty disposition definitely makes up for it.
Good for them.
Together, we will rule Britannia...

You didn't really think he would ever find a woman he deemed worthy enough to marry him, but while on a visit to the court of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], your [GetFromRelation] Lancelot seems to have fallen in love with Guinevere, daughter of the dispossessed King Leodegan of Henis Wyren. It seems that the feeling was mutual, and now the two have now announced their marriage to each other.

While visiting the court of [From.PrimaryTitle.GetName], a beautiful woman catches your eye. She introduces herself as Guinevere, princess of Henis Wyren, and smiles at you, saying that she has been waiting a long time for a man as great and ambitious as you. She emits an aura of beauty, passion, and ambition, and immediately you know you are meant for each other.
Congratulations, I suppose.
Marry me, Guinevere.

Since Arthur's marriage you have noticed that your [GetFromRelation] Derfel being more sullen than usual, seemingly heartbroken. While you're not quite sure why he has become like this, he seems to be consoling himself in the company of his old friend Nimue, and two have become increasingly close over the last few days.

Watching Ceinwyn get married was painful, but you consoled yourself in the knowledge that she would be well cared for in Arthur's hands. As you mourn the loss of your secret love, you find yourself spending more and more time with your old friend Nimue... perhaps she is the one who is truly meant for you?
Good for him, I guess.
I do think we should be together more...

Recently you have noticed your courtier Nimue spending more and more time in the company of [FromFrom.GetBestName]. While you know that they have been friends since childhood, it seems that the two have become rather close as of late, perhaps more than just friends...

Recently your friend Derfel has been spending more and more time with you, heartbroken over Ceinwyn's marriage to Arthur. While you have known each other since you were little in Merlin's tower, you and Derfel are no longer children, and as you get close to him you can feel something more stirring within you...
Well, good for them.
Let us be together under the Gods, Derfel...
The Plague of Justinian

The dreaded pandemic disease known as the 'Plague of Justinian', which has struck and weakened the Eastern Roman Empire during the past few years, has at last reached the coasts of Gaul.

The terrible plague first broke out in Constantinople in 541 AD, and a few months later it had killed almost half of the city's inhabitants. People fled in terror, spreading the disease to ports around the whole known world.

A few days ago, the bubonic plague has claimed its first victim in the province of [Root.Location.GetName], and a dark fear is already spreading among the populace of the neighbouring lands...
This is troubling news, but nothing can be done.
This is the wrath of God! Sinners and pagans will be doomed!
The curse of the Gods is upon us! We shall offer a great sacrifice!
We shall be rational and do what we can to prevent an outbreak...

Orders will be given to take any possible measure to limit the spreading of the plague: anyone showing the signs of the disease will be isolated, infected areas will be contained, the trade of linen or woollen goods will be restricted, and the burial of corpses anywhere near the town or castle walls will be strictly forbidden.\n
Anglo-Saxons Defeated

After a centuries-long series of wars and campaigns, the last remaining Anglo-Saxon kingdoms and hosts have finally been defeated and evicted from the island of Britannia. While some Saxon settlers still remain on the island under their new overlords, the dream of an Anglo-Saxon "Ænglaland" has been brought to a definitive end.\n\nWith the Ingvaeonic tribes on the mainland showing little interest in continuing the attempts, the island of Britannia can finally rest easily, free from the constant threat of foreign invasions. Though there are those who still carefully watch the Oceanus Germanicus, ever wary that one day, warhosts will land on the eastern shore of Britannia once more...
May those barbarians never return. Ever.
Mark my words...! We will rise again!
Pah! Who cares about that forsaken isle anyway?
Weaklings. We can do better than that...
This is interesting news...
The Siege of Ynys Trebes

The armies of the Franks have sieged and conquered the tidal island of Ynys Trebes. The royal family of Benoic has managed to escape the palace and leave the island aboard fishing boats, while the Frankish warriors were climbing the harbour's stone quay and swarming into the city. The great library of Ynys Trebes has been set on fire: centuries of human knowledge and literature are now forever lost to the flames.\n\nThe former King of Benoic and his family fled to Britain, hoping to find refuge at some British ruler's court.
They abandoned their people to death and slavery!
We shouldn't have let them escape...
Escape was our only chance of survival!

We managed to escape the siege of Ynys Trebes and fled to Britain aboard fishing boats. The Franks have sacked the city and set the royal palace and the library on fire. Centuries of human knowledge and literature are now forever lost to the flames...
How could those barbarians do it?
How could those barbarians do it?
Married to a Macsen daughter
My wife is a direct female descendant of the great Imperator, Magnus Maximus, once ruler of all of Britain and Gaul. Through her, I can legitimise my own claim to this land.
Excellent
The Anglian Invasion

Longboats full of Anglian settlers are grounding every month on the eastern shores of Britain. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe Anglian warlords have no choice but to expand their realms to the west, and they are assembling their armies for war. Local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
Excellent! We shall rule over these lands!
They are dangerous foes...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing every month on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more, determined to conquer new lands for the newcomers and their families.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding near the city of Verulanium and the province of Gwash. The local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
The Britons will run and hide in their holes!
They are growing too powerful...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing every month on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more, determined to conquer new lands for the newcomers and their families.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding west into the Chiltern Hills north of the Thames and near the town of Margidunum near Ratae. The local British rulers should strengthen their defenses and be ready to fight for their lands.
The Britons will run and hide in their holes!
They are growing too powerful...
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Along the eastern shores of Britain hundreds of ships are landing. They are full of Germanic settlers fleeing from their burnt and sacked homelands on the continent. These warriors need food, they need land, they are desperate and dangerous. And they are many.\n\nThe Anglian rulers are calling every warrior to arms, and they will soon march west once more, looking for new lands to conquer.
We will destroy our enemies!
They must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Longboats full of Anglian settlers keep landing on the eastern shores of Britain. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe Anglian rulers have no choice but to expand their realms to the west, and they are assembling their armies for war.
Excellent! We will rule over these lands!
We must find a way to stop them!
Interesting news...
The Anglian Invasion

Thousands of Germanic settlers keep landing on the beaches of the Anglo-Saxon Shore. Anglian rulers will soon raise their armies and march to war once more to conquer new lands for their people.\n\nAnglian scouts have been spotted riding deep into the heart of Britain, towards the town of Brinavae...
Excellent! We will rule over these lands!
We must find a way to stop them!
This is interesting news...
The North Angles

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are grounding on the northern shores of Britain, not far from the castle of Din Calaigh, in the province of Bryneich. The British kingdoms of the Old North must prepare to defend their lands from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves north of Hadrian's Wall...
We will conquer the North!
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Where are they? This is MY land!
The North Angles

Another wave of longboats full of Germanic settlers approaches the northern shores of Britain. They are expected to land near the fortified town of Pons Aelii, in the province of Old Tyne. The British kingdoms of the Old North must prepare to defend their lands once more from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves north of Hadrian's Wall...
The Saxon Invasion

Longboats full of Germanic settlers keep grounding on the shores of South Seaxe. The newcomers are hungry and fierce warriors with their wives and children, and they are looking for new lands to call 'home'.\n\nThe lords of Dumnonia will soon have to defend their lands from warbands of Saxon invaders determined to conquer and occupy the rich and fertile provinces of southern Britain, in particular the coastal provinces closest to South Seaxe, an area the Anglo-Saxons call "Meonware".
We will conquer these lands!
No, it is not the right time for an invasion.
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
This is troubling news...
They are a serious threat...

A small fleet of Jutish settlers has arrived in your capital of [Root.Capital.GetName]. Their leader, Port, has asked you for permission to settle his tribesmen in the newly conquered lands of Meonware, promising to swear fealty to your kingdom and help cement your rule over the Romano-British provinces.
More settlers are always welcome.
We do not need any pesky Jutes.
The West Saxons

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are landing on the southern shores of Britain in the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare to defend their lands from these Saxon invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".

Germanic settlers pushing out from the Anglo-Saxon settlements on the Thames Valley are pushing south into lands ruled over by the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare to defend their lands from these new Saxon tribes pushing out from the already settled lands who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the West Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Germanic settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The West Saxons

Another wave of Germanic settlers is approaching the southern shores of Britain in the kingdom of Dumnonia. The British kingdoms of the south must now prepare once more to defend their lands from these Saxon invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves in the rich lands they call "West Seaxe".

It is time for the Jutes to rule in Cantia
No, it would be too risky.
Ultimatum from the Jutes

The Jutes settled in Portus Dubris have sent us an ultimatum, demanding control over the city of Durovernum and all of Cantuaria as a whole. Should we not accept, they have also reminded us that they have many more warriors ready to fight than we do...
We have no choice but to submit.
We will not give up what is rightfully ours!.
Rise of Cantwaras

Recognizing our military superiority, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted our ultimatum and ceded control of the realm over to us. We are now in a position to declare independence and establish our own kingdom of Cantwaras, independent from our former British masters. [Root.GetRandomGodName] willing, a new era has begun in Britannia, where servant rules over master, Saxon over Briton...

The traitorious Jutish foederati settled in Ynys Tanatus have deposed you and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras over your old realm of Cantuaria. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and have let the Romano-British citizens know that the Jutes are the masters now.

The Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom, having rapidly consolidated their control over the area, refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...

The Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and as more settlers from the continent migrate to reinforce and strengthen the kingdom, a new power has been established in Britannia. With the rise of the Jutes in the southeast, it is only a matter of time before other Anglo-Saxons begin to take he oppurtunity to rise up and carve out new realms for themselves...

The Jutes settled in Petuaria have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantwaras in its place. The new Anglo-Saxon kingdom has quickly consolidated their control over the area, and now has the potential to pose a significant threat to the other Romano-British kingdoms in the southeast. Other British kingdoms watch in horror at the rapid fall of Cantuaria and worry about the loyalty of their own foederati - will they be next?
Excellent. Let the rule of the Jutes commence!
We will have our revenge...
Cursed barbarians!
Another Angle kingdom rises!
This is extremely concerning...
Deposition of Cantuaria

The Jutes settled in Portus Dubris have deposed the King of Cantuaria and declared the creation the Kingdom of Cantia in its place. The new Jutish kingdom refuses to swear fealty to us and could become a real threat in the future...
Cursed barbarians!
Ultimatum Refused
[From.GetTitledName] has refused to accept our ultimatum and has even demanded that we submit and surrender immediately!
We will show the Wælisc who is powerful here!
Very well then. We have no choice.
Jutish Foederati Revolt

Unwilling to let us take over peacefully, the Britons have unwisely decided to resist our takeover of Cantuaria, forcing us to take up arms to take what is ours. Once we have defeated the Britons on the field of battle, we will be in a position to assert our dominance over these lands and establish an Angle kingdom of Cantwaras here on the coast of southern Britannia, independent of British rule or overlordship. Perhaps this will be the beginning of the end for the Britons...

The foederati Jutes have refused to submit and have instead declared war against us, intending to intending to take what they want by force. Their forces are rapidly mobilizing, and it seems that we have a fully fledged foederati revolt on our hands - one that will determine the fate of Cantuaria, and perhaps much of Lloegyr as a whole...

Our vassal, [From.GetTitledName], has informed us that the Jutes of Ynys Tanatus have sent an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm. The ultimatum was dismissed, but the Angles have now mobilized against us, and they have now staged a fully fledged foederati revolt, intending to take control over the entirety of Cantuaria...

The foederati Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have revolted against the King of Cantuaria, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Ebrauc, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, this will be a major coup for the Anglo-Saxons, bringing the Jutes to power for the first time and opening up southeast Britannia to increased settlement and invasion. Regardless of the outcome, this revolt will pave the way for the rise of other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms...

The foederati Jutes settled in Ynys Tanatus have revolted against the King of Cantuaria, after an ultimatum demanding the surrender of the realm was refused. War has broken out between the Britons and Angles in Cantuaria, as the foederati rebel against their masters to establish dominance over the realm. \n\nShould the revolt succeed, the fall of Cantuaria will be a significant blow for the Romano-Britons, leaving the kingdoms of the southeast and the city of Londinium vulnerable to invasion. And this may not be the last revolt...
We shall be victorious!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
The barbarians will not take our lands!
The weakling Wælisc will fall easily...
Vile barbarians!
Will we be next?
Jutes Revolt
The Jutes have refused to submit and declared war, intending to take what they want by force!
To war! We will defend our lands from the barbarians!
Jutes Back Down
The Jutes have backed down on their ultimatum and submitted to your rule. [From.GetTitledName] has surrendered and is now imprisoned in your dungeon, at your mercy.
A wise choice...
Rise of Cantia
The Britons have been defeated and we now rule over Durovernum, or Cantwareburh, as the town is now called. With Jutes now in control of the area, we are now in a position to create our own kingdom.
The rule of the Jutes begins today!
The North Folc

Hundreds of longboats full of Germanic settlers are grounding on the northern shores of Britain, not far from the castle of Caer Went, in the province of Icenia. The British kingdoms of the east must prepare to defend their lands from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves...
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is troubling news...
Where are they? This is MY land!
Angles in Nortwic

The invading armies of the East Angles have conquered the province of Nortwic, and more ships full of Germanic settlers land every day.\n\nThe local Britons have abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Anglo-Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
The East Angles

Another wave of longboats full of Germanic settlers approaches the eastern shores of Britain. They are expected to land near the fortified town of Venta Icenorum, in the province of Went. The British kingdoms of the east must prepare to defend their lands once more from these Anglian invaders from across the sea, who are apparently determined to conquer new lands for themselves...
The Great Dyke of [Root.GetFirstName]

The Anglo-Saxon rulers of central Britain have erected a massive earthwork along their western border, from the hills of Kenceaster in the south, to the crossing of the river Severn near Wroxeter in the north. The defensive structure is a statement of power, and will protect Anglo-Saxon lands from the native Britons still ruling in the deep valleys of Gwynedd and Powys.\n\nThis great barrier effectively seperates the Anglo-Saxon territories from the remaining British lands in the west, firmly dividing the island in two. With the loss of their heartlands, the Britons have now effectively ended the old elective system of Britannia, and now sturggle for dominance over the remaining lands that they call 'Cymru'.
Let the Wealas flee and hide into their mountains... little dogs!
This is most worrisome...
This is quite interesting news...
The Kingdom of Strathclyde

The northern Celtic kingdom of Ystrad Clud is now ruled by an Anglo-Saxon king.\n\nA new language is spoken at court, new customs are being introduced, and from now on the realm will be known as 'Kingdom of Strathclyde'.
This is interesting news...
The Roman Fort of Magnis
The ancient Roman fort of Magnis has been sacked and burned to the ground by the Anglo-Saxon invaders who now rule the province.
The legacy of Rome is fading away...

column1: ### SAXON INVASION OF SALLAND AND HAMALAND ###

column2: Saxon Incursions

The Saxon tribes of northern Germania are on the move. Saxon settlers and warbands are pouring west from Westphalia, into the old Frankish lands of the Salii and Chamavi north of the Rhine. The remaining Frankish tribes of the area must now prepare to defend their lands from these new tribes pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hamaland".
We will rule these lands!
They are a serious threat...
This is interesting news...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Saxon settlers arrive by the day.\n\nThe local Franks have by and large abandoned their homes and fled the region, leaving the Saxons in full control of the province.
This is interesting news...
Saxon Incursions

The Saxon tribes of northern Germania are on the move once more. Saxon settlers and warbands are again pouring west from Westphalia, into the old Frankish lands of the Salii and Chamavi north of the Rhine. The remaining Frankish tribes of the area must now once more prepare to defend their lands from these new tribes pushing deep into the west, seeking to conquer new lands for themselves in the lands they call "Hamaland".
Our rule in the British isles grows stronger every year!
They are a serious threat...
This is interesting news...
You have received word that your vassal [From.GetTitledName] has raised a large host from his lands and is about to embark on an adventure to carve out a new realm in Gaul.
Well... good luck with that!

You have received word that [From.GetTitledName] has raised a large army from his realm in Germania and is now sailing towards Gaul. [From.GetHerHis] warband of fierce Saxon warriors is coming to raid, pillage, and conquer...
We will defeat these barbarians!

You have declared your intentional to found a new realm in Gaul, and a large number of adventerous warriors eager to fight for the riches of that land from your realm and beyond have begun to gather at your court. In about two months, you should have gathered a large enough host to go on your adventure.
Land, plunder, and glory await!
You and your men begin your preparations for the invasion.

The preperations for your Gallic adventure are complete. Your newly raised fleet and army are now sitting in your harbour, full of eager, fierce warriors impatiently waiting for you to take them to war in Gaul for plunder, glory, and land.
[Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] will grant us victory!

You may now use the §YDuchy Invasion§! casus belli against any one non-Germanic ruler in the region of §YNorthwestern Gaul§!, expiring in one month. Upon declaring the invasion, you will receive a number of event troops and an event fleet. Roman areas are an easier target to hold on to, as the hardy Armoricans will be significantly more difficult to subdue and assimilate.
Army Arrives
The great army you have raised for your Gallic adventure has arrived. Your enemies will surely tremble when they hear of the great warriors about to descend on their defenseless lands!
To Gaul we go!
Gallic Conquest

Leaving your old realm in Germania behind, you have won a great victory and conquered for yourself a new kingdom in Gaul. While the Franks, Visigoths, Armoricans, and any remaining Roman authorities may still pose a threat to your kingdom, you have let the people of Gaul know that the [From.Culture.GetName]s are here to rule and here to stay.
The rule of the [From.Culture.GetName]s begins today!
Invasion Abandoned
Having waited for a month for you to bring them to Gaul, the army you have raised for the invasion has largely dispersed, disillusioned and disappointed that you have broken your promises.
Fools...
Saxons in [Root.GetName]

The invading armies of the Saxons have conquered the province of [Root.GetName], and more and more Saxon settlers arrive by the day. They now form a majority in [Root.GetName] as the local Gallic populace is slowly outnumbered and pushed out of the region.
Excellent.
All titles outside of Northwestern Gaul are abdicated to your current heir.

Preparations for the migration across the sea have begun, as our people pack up their livestock and belongings and gather near the fleet of ships we have constructed for the migration. While some of our tribesmen have chosen to stay behind in our homeland, the majority of what remains of the Angle nation now prepares to cross the German Sea and make our new home in Britannia.
It is for the good of our people.
The Migration of the Angles

Struggling from the effects of past migrations and pressure from the ascendant Danes, the last of the Angles in their homeland on the continent have decided to leave their homeland forever to join their brethren in Britannia. Under the leadership of their king, [Root.GetTitledName], the Angle nation is now sailing across the German Sea, determined to find a new home in Britannia as the Danes take over their former kingdom.\n\nThe British kingdoms of the Midlands must now keep guard as the Angles seek land to settle on, and though the realm of the [Root.GetOnlyDynastyName]s may for now remain small, the old prestige and ambition of their people means that it may not stay so...
Onwards to a new Anglia!
May they find a new home to settle in.
Excellent! Let our brethren join us in our new lands!
Let them go to their faraway lands...
Those barbarians must be stopped!
This is interesting news...
You abandon Angeln for new lands abroad.
Help for the Angles

You have received a request from [From.GetFirstName], the former King of the Angles now leading his people in Nortwic, for aid in acquiring new terrritories to settle in. In return for helping them to conquer the British province of [angles_province.GetName] which they eye as their new home, [From.GetFirstName] has agreed to swear fealty to you.
Of course we will help our brothers in need!
No. They can fight for themselves.
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

We have landed at the port of Nortwic, and our tribe and armies are now making our way towards the Briton kingdoms to the west, towards the province of [angles_province.GetName] that we have chosen as our target. In return for suzerainty over our kingdom, [From.GetTitledName] has given us aid and supplies to help us conquer [angles_province.GetName] and make it our new home.
Excellent! This land will soon be ours!
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

We have landed at the port of Nortwic, and our tribe and armies are now making our way towards the Briton kingdoms to the west, towards the province of [angles_province.GetName] that we have chosen as our target. Despite our requests, [From.GetTitledName] has refused to help us in our conquest of the province - something they will pay for in the future...
We will conquer it anyway!
Invasion of [angles_province.GetName]

Having crossed the German Sea, we have chosen the Briton province of [angles_province.GetName] as our target, and our tribe and armies have landed and are quickly making their way to take control of the province. [Root.Religion.GetRandomGodName] willing, this will soon be our new home.
Our new kingdom begins here!
Conquest of [Root.Capital.GetName]

Our armies have triumphed over the Britons, and already our people are settling in [Root.Capital.GetName] mixing with and displacing the native Briton populace. Our people have successfully crossed the sea, and we have managed to establish our own kingdom here in this new land.
This will be our new realm and home.
It seems that our war of conquest for a province to call our new home has become invalid.
We'll just have to try again.
Angles Defeated

Our armies have been defeated by the Britons, and we have been unable to carve off the province we desired as our new realm and home. However, already our tribe is reorganizing and raising another army to fight - hopefully successfully this time...
We will not be defeated again!
Angles Defeated

We have been defeated by the Britons once more, and this time we do not have the manpower to try again. Now, we must try to settle our tribe on more friendly lands - hopefully one of the other Anglo-Saxon kingdoms will allow us to settle on their lands...
Our brothers will help us in our time of need...
Request for Settlement

[From.GetFirstName], the former King of the Angles now leading his people in Nortwic, has come forward to you, requesting that you allow [From.GetHerHis] tribe to settle in your province of [angles_province.GetName]. [From.GetSheHe] has agreed to swear fealty to you in return, and [From.GetHerHis] tribe will quickly assimilate the current British majority there.
The province is yours to settle in.
No. This land is our land.
Settlement Granted

[From.GetTitledName] has graciously granted us the right to settle in their province of [angles_province.GetName]. Our tribesmen are now settling in the province, setting up homesteads and forts as our people mix with and displace the native British populace. Our people have successfully crossed the sea, and we have managed to establish our own kingdom here in this new land.
A new home and a new era for our people...
Failed Migration

Our attempts at conquest have failed, and none of our brethren are willing or able to give us land to settle our tribe in. Without any land to call home, our once-mighty nation has been forced to disperse, breaking up to try to find a home with whomever will take them, ending our dream of a new home in Britannia.
We will not be forgotten!

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] is beginning to recover from the nearly desolate province it once was. Fallow fields are being cleared once more, abandoned settlements are seeing signs of inhabitation and the province seems to be gradually returning to normal.

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] has recovered significantly from the depopulations and migrations of the past. Much of the land is beginning to be worked again, settlements are beginning to bustle and the province is returning to its full potential.

After years of immigration and natural growth, the population of [Root.GetName] has recovered from the depopulations and migrations of the past. The land has been largely reclaimed, thriving settlements now dot the province and the province has returned to its full potential.
Excellent. May [Root.GetName] prosper once more.

We have sent an emissary to the King of Bryneich, offering him our services as foederati in his kingdom. Should he accept, we will be allowed to settle in his coastal lands and paid in exchange for fighting on his behalf. Of course, this arrangement might not last forever...
I am sure we can come to a mutually beneficial arrangement.
Foederati Request

You have received an emissary from [From.GetTitledName] offering his services to you as foederati. His warbands and peoples would be of great use against the wretched Picts and Scots that have so ravaged our lands, though the tribulations of our cousins in Lloegyr serves as a stark warning of what could go wrong. Then again, the Saxons of the North have so far been quite docile and cooperative, so perhaps our foederati will not become an existential threat to us, and if we do not grant them land on our terms, they may take it from us on theirs...
We are in need of foederati.
There will be no Saxons in my kingdom.
Settlement Granted

Our emissary has returned, bringing the news that [From.GetTitledName] has agreed to grant us the province of [angle_target_province.GetName] to settle in in exchange for our service as foederati. Our people are now packing their belongings and making the journey to their new home in Beornice.
Excellent! Fame and fortune await!
Settlement Denied

Our emissary has returned with the news that [From.GetTitledName] has refused our offer of foederati status, clearly fearing the fate of the Britons to the south. We will have to remain here in Norþfolc for now, but in time, we may eventually be able to acquire land of our own - by force...
One way or another, the North will be ours...
The Frankish Invasion of Soissons

Ever since the Crossing of the Rhine decades ago, the Roman Empire has been raided, beseiged, and ultimately destroyed by hordes of Germanic invaders intent on conquest. Only the Domain of Soissons in Northern Gaul survived the conquests, forging alliances with the Franks to defend this Roman rump state from other invaders intent on conquering this rich land. \n\nBut now, Childeric of the Franks, the great ally of the Syagrii in Soissons, is dead. The new king, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] of the Franks, has no such alliance or friendship with the Romans and has declared an invasion of Soissons, claiming it for his own, a war that will decide the fate of Gaul and all of Western Europe forever.
We will show those Romans who is powerful now!
No, perhaps those Romans will be useful later.
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
This is worrying news...
This is interesting news...
The Frankish War on Benoic

Thousands of Frankish warriors are assembling outside the walls of [Root.Capital.GetName]. According to rumors, the King of the Franks is preparing to march to war against the Armorican kingdom of Benoic.\n\nFrankish warbands have been sighted in the wooden hills of central Benoic, hiding during the day and coming out at night like packs of wolves to sack, pillage and burn.
Benoic will be crushed and Ynys Trebes shall burn!
No, perhaps those Amoricans will be useful later.
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
They are a fearsome and powerful enemy...
Interesting news...
The Frankish War on the Visigoths

For years, tensions between the expansionist Franks and the Visigoths to the south have been rising, as the two great Germanic kingdoms feud over supremacy of Gaul. As the Franks cement their control over the newly conquered Northern Gaul, the Visigoths look on in concern, worrying that they will be the next target of the seemingly unstoppable Frankish expansion- and rightfully so. \n\nNow, sensing weakness and division in the Kingdom of the Visigoths, [Root.GetFirstName], King of the Franks, has declared an invasion and marched into Visigothic territory, claiming all of Gaul as his own. As the Visigoths defend prepare to defend their land, all watch to see who will emerge dominant over Gaul.
The Visigoths will be destroyed, for all of Gaul is ours to take!
No, perhaps those Visigoths will be useful later.
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
They are a fearsome and powerful enemy...
Interesting news...
The Frankish Invasion of Burgundy

After the fall of the Roman Empire, the Burgundians maintained an alliance, if shaky, with the Franks to the north, with the two Germanic kingdoms supporting each other as they expanded at the expense of the Romans and Goths. However, as the Franks continued to grow and become more and more powerful, mercilessly conquering and destroying their neighbours, relations began to sour as the Franks became drawn into the various conflicts within the royal family. \n\nNow, after several raids and skirmishes between the two kingdoms, [Root.GetTitledFirstName] has finally invaded with the intention of conquering the entire kingdom. Now, the Burgundians must make their stand or be destroyed and absorbed into the realms of the Franks, like so many before them.
The treacherous Burgundians will be destroyed!
No, perhaps those Burgundians will be useful later.
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
They are a fearsome and powerful enemy...
Interesting news...
The Frankish Invasion of Provence

With the start of the Gothic War, Ostrogothic forces have been largely withdrawn from Provence for the defence of Italia, leaving the Praetorian Prefecture of Gaul to fend for itself. Seeking an opportunity, [Root.GetTitledName] has laid claim to the area declared war, seeking the riches of Provence for [Root.GetHerselfHimself].\n\nAs the prefect desperately gathers what militas and forces he can muster, an enormous Frankish host prepares to bear down on the largely undefended province. It may be only a matter of time before the period of Ostrogothic dominion in Gaul is put to a definitive end.
The Ostrogoths would be no match for us anyways.
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
They are a fearsome and powerful enemy...
Interesting news...
The Frankish Invasion of Alemannia

Continuous tensions and raids between the Franks and Alemanni along their shared border have finally come to a head and broken into all-out war. Vowing to break the power of the Alemanni once and for all, [Root.GetTitledName] has raised a large army and launched an invasion of the Alemannic heartland.\n\nThe Alemanni were once among the fiercest and most tenacious enemies of Rome, but now face a threat of a completely different kind. It remains to see if the Alemanni will be able to successfully defend their treasured independence, or if the strength of the Franks is simply too much to bear.
Let us bring the light of [Root.Religion.GetHighGodName] to those barbarians!
Excellent! We will soon rule over these lands!
They are a fearsome and powerful enemy...
Interesting news...
Defeat of the Franks

The fearsome Frankish tribes that occupied much of Roman Germania and Belgica in the Empire's moments of weakness have finally been decisively defeated. Their petty kingdoms carved out of Roman land have been subjugated or destroyed, and the Frankish nobility has either bent down to Roman overlordship once more or fled across the old Roman frontier into Magna Germania. While independent Frankish lords still rule in their ancestral lands across the Rhine, never again will the Franks pose such a grave threat to the heart of Gaul.
Rome has prevailed!
At last, those barbarians have been defeated...
We have not be defeated! We will return!
This is interesting news...
Rise of the Franks

It seems that the return of Roman dominance over Gaul was not to be. The Frankish tribes have mustered their fearsome warriors and poured over the Limes Germanicus once more, overrunning the Roman defences of the Rhine and reoccupying the northeastern provinces of Gaul. Parts of Belgica and northern Germania are once again under the rule of Frankish kings, and cities and courts of Gaul are rife with concern. \n\nWith the Franks on the rise once more, the fate of Gaul once more hangs on a precipice. Will the Franks finally be able to assert their dominance over the many province of Gaul? Or will the Romans prevail against the Germanic invaders once more?
Gaul will be ours, once and for all!
The barbarians will be defeated!
This is worrying news...
This is interesting news...
The Free Town of Caletum

The rich and powerful sailor merchants of Caletum, displeased by the intolerable taxes imposed on their trades by their feudal lord, have quietly plotted against him and successfully removed him from power.

After having obtained control over the town and its prosperous portual market, the merchants have proclaimed self-jurisdiction and formally declared the birth of the 'Commune of Caletum'.

A powerful local trader, [From.Liege.GetFirstName], is currently the highest civil authority and 'de facto' ruler of the province. Under the title of [From.Liege.GetTitledName], he has sworn fealty to [From.Liege.Liege.GetTitledName].
Merchants? Is this happening for real?
This is interesting news...
Uniting the Franks

We Franks would be stronger united, and little comes of quarelling amongst ourselves. We have sent emissaries to all the other Frankish kings, inviting them to swear fealty to us or face our wrath. Might makes right, and all Franks will soon learn of your superior skill and strength.
We will bring them all under our fold, one way or another...
Emissaries are sent to all the other Frankish kings.
Uniting the Franks

An emissary has arrived from [From.GetTitledName]. He heaps praise upon our prestige amongst the Frankish nation, poetically imploring us to share in his liege's greater vision. Whilst he speaks of the great things the Franks could do united, he also warns confidently of the great force that will be raised against us if we do not submit. Your hall falls deathly silent.
The Franks will be stronger united.
I will not bow to this upstart!
Uniting the Franks
Your emmissary returns with a wagon of tribute, and a spring in his step. [From.GetTitledName] has acknowledged you as his new suzerain, and will serve your greater Frankish realm forthwith.
Excellent. He has made a wise choice.
Uniting the Franks

Your emmisary has returned empty handed from [From.GetTitledName], his hair having been cut to the scalp and sporting one less ear than he had when he departed. [From.GetTitledName] has scorned your demand to join the greater Frankish realm.
How dare [From.GetSheHe]?!? To war!
We will deal with [From.GetHerHim] later...
Unification of the Franks

In past times, the disunity of the Germanic tribes lining the Roman Empire has been their greatest weakness. Never before has the ambition of any one ruler been enough to challenge the might of Rome, but no longer. The Franks are now fully united, both Salian and Ripuarian, and the might of [Root.GetTitledName] is spoken of with fear all across western Europe. In Gaul the remnants of Rome and even the other Germanic kingdoms beyond regard [Root.GetTitledName] with trepidation, and rightly so. The rise of the Franks shows no signs of stopping. United under a common banner, the power of the Franks may well be enough to topple Roman rule once and for all.
All of Gaul will tremble under my name!
May [Root.GetTitledName] bring glory to the Franks!
This is worrying news...
This is interesting news...
An Ultimatum Arrives

An emissary has arrived from [From.GetTitledName] with a rather alarming demand. Accusing you and your court of all sorts of lecherous deeds and unforgivable slights against against [From.GetHerHim], [From.GetBestName] demands that we give up our kingdom and submit fully to [From.GetHerHis] rule, or face war.
I suppose we have no choice...
This is an outrage! Never!
Demand Accepted

Much to your surprise, [From.GetTitledName] has accepted the terms of your ultimatum, and has essentially delivered [From.GetHerHis] entire kingdom over to your control. The emissary offers many humble apologies on behalf of [From.GetFirstName], and entreats you to treat [From.GetHerHim] and [From.GetHerHis] family with mercy.
Excellent.
Demand Refused

Your emissary has arrived rather worse for wear, the victim of [From.GetTitledName]'s rage at your accusations and demands. [From.GetTitledName] has cut off all ties and alliances, and it seems that there will not be a peaceful resolution to the problem.
Well, this will be a quick war.
The Danish March

Fearing the growing power and the destructive raids of the Norse, [Root.GetTitledName] has declared the creation of the 'Danish March' on the lands between the Eider and the Schlei. The newly created march has been incorporated into the Kingdom of Saxony and will be heavily fortified and garrisoned, to serve as a first line of defence for the [Root.PrimaryTitle.GetFullName] in the north.\n\n Already the Vikings are testing the march's defences, raiding its lands and attacking its castles. Time will tell if this fortified borderland will truly be able to protect the Danish border...
The barbarians will not pass!
